intro: Stenostephanus cochabambensis, commonly known as the Cochabamba stephanus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and alternate, with a slightly hairy surface. This species is adapted to cold, dry climates and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations above 3,000 meters.
